title: JFK Airport’s Busiest Terminal Seen Recovering From Covid-19 Slowly
sub_head: Operator of Terminal 4 says pandemic forces it to scale back or delay $3.8 billion refurbishment and expansion
body:
The operator of John F. Kennedy International Airport’s busiest terminal said its passenger numbers might not return to pre-pandemic levels until 2024, leading it to scale back or delay a planned $3.8 billion refurbishment and expansion.
JFK International Air Terminal LLC, which operates Terminal 4, said in a Nov. 30 bond-offering statement that it is talking to the agency that runs the New York City airport about alternatives such as providing interim upgrades and reducing the scope of the planned terminal refurbishment and...
